name: Media Ethics and Policy: Controversies in Mass Communication
description: Formerly SOC284H5: This course examines conflicts and controversies in the media. The goal of the course is to analyze power struggles within the realm of the media in order to understand how they both reflect and can reinforce broader social inequalities. Special emphasis is paid to the role of media policies and regulations. Topics include censorship, violence, pornography, marketing, intellectual property and privacy. [24L]
prerequisites: SOC205H5/231H5, 221H5, 0.5 SOC credit at the 200 level
